question: What is the content of the METLIN database?
ideal_answer: METLIN is a metabolite database containing tandem mass spectrometry data for each metabolite.

snippets.text: The tandem mass spectrometry data acquisition enabled automatic search and matching against the METLIN tandem mass spectrometry database,
Numbers of unique metabolites that are specific to a particular sample preparation approach were also identified by online available database, Metlin.
Following high mass accuracy data analysis using MS and MS/MS, metabolites were identified by searching against major metabolite databases including METLIN
Untargeted features were annotated via matching to the METLIN metabolite database.
Liquid chromatography quadrupole time-of-flight mass spectrometry characterization of metabolites guided by the METLIN database.
The correlated metabolin and their metabolic pathways were identified using Metlin Database.
Major metabolite databases include Human Metabolome DataBase (HMDB), Madison Metabolomics Consortium Database (MMCD), Metlin, and LIPID MAPS.
METLIN accurate mass matching database (DB) established according to those reported in the literatures
METLIN: a metabolite mass spectral database.

METLINincludes an annotated list of known metabolite structural information that is easily cross-correlated with its catalogue of high-resolution Fourier transform mass spectrometry (FTMS) spectra, tandem mass spectrometry (MS/MS) spectra, and LC/MS data.
online database (METLIN) to find and identify metabolites
high quality experimental MS/MS data from known metabolites contained in a reference library (METLIN).

exact_answer: METLIN is a metabolite database containing tandem mass spectrometry data for each metabolite.
